title: Agriculture Technology Revolutionizes The Way We Raise Cattle!

tasks.task: Managing and herding a large cattle herd using helicopters
subtasks: Coordinating the flight plan and timing for helicopter mustering
Refuelling and pre-flight inspection of the helicopter
Piloting the helicopter to locate and approach the cattle herd
Using the helicopter's low flight to herd cattle using a herding stick and engine noise
Flying the helicopter to guide the herd towards the gathering point
Working with ground crew in pick-up trucks to direct the herd
Monitoring cattle health and behavior via aerial view
Utilizing satellite or GPS technology for location tracking and route planning
Handling challenging terrains (e.g., hills, wetlands) during flight
Responding to adverse weather conditions and adjusting flight tactics
Rescuing cattle trapped in difficult locations using helicopters

tasks.task: Employing drones for cattle herding and field monitoring
subtasks: Programming drones to fly at optimal altitude and speed for herding
Using drone-generated noise and movement to startle and direct cattle
Integrating drone technology with crop monitoring and pest management

tasks.task: Immense herding operations in Central Asia
subtasks: Constraining massive cattle herds numbering in the thousands to feedlots
Utilizing proximity to natural pastures and water sources for low-stress herding
Training calves for weaning and transitioning to cows
Implementing rotational grazing systems to optimize pasture health
Collecting and storing hay for winter feed
Supplementing cattle feed with grains during harsh winters
Operating specialized milking machines for dairy farms
Managing organic certification processes for meat and dairy products
Selling beef and dairy products in local markets and for export

tasks.task: Adapting traditional herding techniques with modern tools
subtasks: Balancing the use of helicopters, drones, and mobile apps for herding
Maintaining traditional grazing practices while integrating technology
Millennia-old herding methods interacting with contemporary commercial farming
